metadata.title: CVE-2020-28022 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Exim 4 before 4.94.2 has Improper Restriction of Write Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer. This occurs when processing name=value pairs within MAIL FROM and RCPT TO commands.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-28022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-base - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-config - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-daemon-light - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
eximon4 - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.94-15ubuntu1.2').
